name: Gulp
description: Gulp is a toolkit for automating painful or time-consuming tasks in your development workflow, so you can stop messing around and build something.

name: Vite
description: Vite is a build tool that aims to provide a faster and leaner development experience for modern web projects. It consists of two major parts: a dev server that provides rich feature enhancements over native ES Module imports, and a build command that bundles your code with Rollup, pre-configured to output highly optimized static assets for production.

name: EsBuild
description: Esbuild is an extremely fast JavaScript bundler and minifier. It is written in Go and can be used as a library or a standalone tool.

name: Parcel
description: Parcel is a web application bundler, differentiated by its developer experience. It offers blazing fast performance utilizing multi-core processing, and requires zero configuration.

name: Webpack
description: Webpack is a static module bundler for modern JavaScript applications. When webpack processes your application, it internally builds a dependency graph which maps every module your project needs and generates one or more bundles.

name: Rollup
description: Rollup is a module bundler for JavaScript which compiles small pieces of code into something larger and more complex, such as a library or application.

name: Hugo Pipes
description: Hugo Pipes is a new feature in Hugo 0.55.0 that allows you to process your static assets with a pipeline of tools. This is a very powerful feature that allows you to do things like minify your CSS and JavaScript, process your SCSS files, and much more.

name: Jekyll Assets
description: Jekyll Assets is a plugin for Jekyll that allows you to use the asset pipeline to compile, minify, and fingerprint your assets.

name: NPM Scripts
description: NPM Scripts are a way to run predefined commands through the command line. They are defined in the package.json file and can be run with npm run <command>.
